name: Fabienne's 'Black-Eyed' Crab Cakes
author: Fabienne Riesen
summary: Black-eyed peas replace the traditional crackers or breadcrumbs in this recipe. The delicate flavor from the peas help bring out the crab's savory taste. There's no need to add lemon juice to these cakes: the zest ties the seasonings together. This is definitely a winning recipe: a must try!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
⅓ cup rinsed and drained canned black-eyed peas
1 (16 ounce) can crab meat, drained and chunked
directions: Whisk lemon zest, mustard powder, seafood seasoning, onion powder, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl
Add black-eyed peas to lemon zest mixture and smash with a fork until mixture is crumbly
Stir egg and mayonnaise into pea mixture; gently fold in crab meat and Parmesan cheese until combined
Pour bread crumbs into a shallow bowl and press patties into bread crumbs, coating both sides
Place patties on a plate and refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; fry patties until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side
